article.headline: Portland 76, UC Riverside 70
article.story: RIVERSIDE, Calif. (AP) -- Pooh Jeter scored 25 points in Portland's 76-70 victory over UC Riverside Wednesday night. Trailing 52-51 in the second half, the Pilots (9-3) used a 9-2 run to build a 60-54 lead. The Highlanders (4-4) pulled within two at 62-60 with 5:44 remaining after a jumper by Justin Bell. UC Riverside's rally was cut short when an offensive foul was called on Vili Morton with 2:04 to play and the Highlanders down 68-64. Jeter made a jumper for Portland and Jeremiah Dominguez hit a pair of free throws to put the lead at eight, 72-64, with 50 seconds to go. Larry Cunningham came off the bench to score 19 points for UC Riverside. Cunningham made 7 of 11 from the field including 5 of 7 from behind the 3-point line. Vili Morton added 18. Portland's Darren Cooper had 14 points and Marcus Lewis had 10 for the Pilots.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
